intro: Hieracium transiens subsp. ceahlavicum, commonly known as the Ceahlău hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to the Carpathian Mountains in Romania. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellowish to reddish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats at moderate elevations. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy as well. This subspecies is of particular interest to botanists due to its restricted distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
